Package cams.enquiry.enquirer_controller

Interface EnquirerController

All Known Implementing Classes:
StudentEnquirerController
public interface EnquirerController
The EnquirerController interface defines methods that allow users with enquirer roles to submit, edit, and delete posts related to a specific camp.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean delete​(User user, int postIndex)
    Deletes an existing post submitted by the user.
    boolean edit​(User user, int postIndex, java.lang.String content)
    Edits the content of an existing post submitted by the user.
    boolean submit​(java.lang.String campName, User user, java.lang.String text)
    Submits a new post related to a specific camp.
    int view​(User user)
    Interface to display the enquiries of the user and returns the count of those enquiries.

  • Method Details

    • submit

      boolean submit​(java.lang.String campName, User user, java.lang.String text)
      Submits a new post related to a specific camp.
      Parameters:
      campName - The name of the camp for which the post is submitted.
      user - The user submitting the post.
      text - The content of the submitted post.
      Returns:
      true if the submission is successful, false otherwise.

    • edit

      boolean edit​(User user, int postIndex, java.lang.String content)
      Edits the content of an existing post submitted by the user.
      Parameters:
      user - The user editing the post.
      postIndex - The index of the post to be edited.
      content - The new content for the post.
      Returns:
      true if the edit is successful, false otherwise.

    • delete

      boolean delete​(User user, int postIndex)
      Deletes an existing post submitted by the user.
      Parameters:
      user - The user deleting the post.
      postIndex - The index of the post to be deleted.
      Returns:
      true if the deletion is successful, false otherwise.

    • view

      int view​(User user)
      Interface to display the enquiries of the user and returns the count of those enquiries. Each enquiry is displayed with its index and content.
      Parameters:
      user - The user whose enquiries are to be displayed.
      Returns:
      The number of enquiries displayed. 0 = no enquiries by user. -1 = no camps.
